Text: Advisory Statements for May writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Dear Market Participants The latest versions of advisory statements have been posted to each customers web site for the billing month of May

INVOICE SCHEDULING CHANGE writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Market Participants All advisory statements for and have been posted to each customers web site will be done this evening The NYISO was originally scheduled to invoice November and December on Friday We have decided to delay this until next week to allow extra time verifying the data and determining the correct version mapping for reconciling invoices April and August will be posted on as scheduled Payment dates associated with the November and December will be adjusted as necessary Market participants will be notified of any change when the invoices get posted We apologize for the tardiness of this announcement If you have any questions concerning this announcement please contact your market representative at

CHANGE TO THE ADVISORY STATEMENTS BEGINNING On Market Participants will have new billing codes in their advisory statements Code which currently exists in the hrly advisory statement but up until now it has been null Code will now be Hrly LRR DAM Contract Bal Pmnt This will reflect dollars paid to a generator for DAM Contract Balancing that is OutofMerit for LRR Code will reflect dollars paid to a generator for DAM Contract Balancing and is not OutofMerit for LRR The sum and can be found under the Power Supplier section of the daily advisory statement Code this is a new addition that did not exist on the daily csv file before Code is ELR DAM Contract Balancing Payment There is not an hrly code for ELR DAM Contract Balancing because it is a daily settlement not an hrly settlement The funds that will be collected from the LSEs to pay for Code and Code will be collected through the residual adjustment codes hrly and daily Version of the data dictionary will reflect these new billing codes and this will be found on the NYISO website under Grid Accounting Settlements just like the previous versions A new billing code mapping will also be available and will be version and can also be found under the Grid Accounting Settlements section on the NYISO website See attached file Version Data Dictionarydoc Version Data Dictionarydoc

July Advisory writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Dear Market Participants This is a message that will be posted each month as a request from market participants who attended the last Billing Accounting Workshop The suggestion was to have a simple statement posted to the web letting each customer know that the last version for each billing day of the month has been posted In the future this will simply be The latest versions of advisory statements have been posted to each customers web site for the billing month of mmmyyyy If you have any questions please contact customer relations at

Advisory Statement Announcement writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List This is a correction to the last message sent to the TIE I had incorrectly put Jun instead of Jul Dear Market Participants The latest versions of advisory statements have been posted to each customers web site for the billing month of Jul The latest versions of advisory statements have been posted to each customers web site for the billing month of Aug The latest versions of advisory statements have been posted to each customers web site for the billing month of Mar The latest versions of advisory statements have been posted to each customers web site for the billing month of Jul

April Advisory writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Market Participants New advisory statements for April have been posted to your secure web sites as of The reason for the update is due to a printing error in the previous version for LRR Uplift charges Some of you may have had problems getting the LRR dollars in line with what you were invoiced due to this printing error It is important to note that the bills were NOT rerun just reprinted If you have any questions please contact customer relations at
Posting writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Market Participants The NYISO will be posting invoices for July March July and August on not as stated on the schedule posted on our web site

July Advisory writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Market Participants In the early evening hours on the NYISO inadvertently ran a billing job for This created a version of the bills for this billing date Version is not valid all customers should use version when reconciling their advisory statements to their invoice If you have any questions please contact Customer Relations at

May June st settlement adjustment invoice banking writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Market Participants In a billing inquiry sent to us concerning the June adjustments made per the email below which was sent on we noticed an incorrect value was stated for the NYISO clearing account balance prior to adjustment That value was The value should have been and this has caused problems for reconciling your invoices We apologize for any confusion that may have been caused by this misstatement Any questions concerning this issue can be directed to customer relations at Customers should note that their invoices have been adjusted to recognize a net zero impact to the NYISO clearing account Each settlement adjustment was performed to report each customers share in residual adjustments and uplift In the initial billing of these periods the monthly OATT Schedule rates were computed with forecasted residual uplift costs Had the NYISO settled residuals and uplift in the current period as it now does customers would have realized these costs immediately The advisory billing statement formats now reported by the NYISO allow customers to see the actual costs of these components Once the net NYISO clearing account impact from these billings was determined an adjustment was computed based upon customers respective ratio shares of transmission service settled during each month adjust these costs out of their settlements Any difference between the adjustment and residual uplift costs reported on the advisory statements are due to additional residuals or uplift from the settlement adjustment process June adjustment to recognize a net zero impact to the NYISO clearing account NYISO clearing account balance prior to adjustment strikethrough Customer Adjustment Customers June Transmission Service Transacted x strikethrough MWh

July advisory writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Market Participants On at the billing date of was incorrectly rerun and printed to the web creating a version This version has been removed from the web and version has been restored We apologize for any confusion this may have caused If you have any questions concerning this issue please contact customer relations at
